Package com.storage.engine

Class Buffer

java.lang.Object
com.storage.engine.Buffer
public class Buffer extends Object
The Buffer class represents a write buffer for the Write-Ahead Logging (WAL) file. It provides methods to initialize, manage, and interact with the buffer.

If the index for a random retrieval points to an offset beyond the WAL file's actual location, it is assumed to be located in the write buffer.

  • Constructor Details

    • Buffer

      public Buffer(Config dbConfig, boolean readOnly)
      Initializes a write buffer for the Write-Ahead Logging (WAL) file with the specified configuration. The buffer is initialized based on the provided database configuration and read-only flag.

      The initialization process follows these steps: Calculates the maximum number of records that can fit within a 4 MB buffer. If the calculated value is less than the predefined constant Config.RECORDS_PER_BLOCK, it sets the maximum number of records to 128. This condition occurs for very large values. Adjusts the maximum number of records to be a multiple of 128. Calculates the number of bytes required to accommodate the CRCs and sync markers. Finally, initializes a write buffer with the calculated number of bytes.

      Parameters:
      dbConfig - The configuration used to produce the database instance.
      readOnly - Indicates whether the buffer is read-only.

    • flush

      public int flush(OutputStream out) throws IOException
      Flushes the contents of the buffer to the specified output stream.
      Parameters:
      out - The output stream to flush the buffer to.
      Returns:
      The number of bytes flushed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • readFromFiles

      void readFromFiles(List<RandomAccessFile> files, boolean reverse, Consumer<ByteBuffer> recordConsumer) throws IOException
      Reads data from multiple files and applies a record consumer to each record.
      Parameters:
      files - The list of files to read from.
      reverse - Indicates whether to read the files in reverse order.
      recordConsumer - The consumer function to apply to each record.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • readFromFile

      void readFromFile(RandomAccessFile file, boolean reverse, Consumer<ByteBuffer> recordConsumer) throws IOException
      Reads data from a file and applies a record consumer to each record.
      Parameters:
      file - The file to read from.
      reverse - Indicates whether to read the file in reverse order.
      recordConsumer - The consumer function to apply to each record.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • fillBuffer

      private int fillBuffer(RandomAccessFile file, Consumer<ByteBuffer> recordConsumer, boolean reverse) throws IOException
      Reads data from a random access file and fills a buffer with the read bytes, then applies a consumer function to each record in the buffer.
      Parameters:
      file - The random access file to read from.
      recordConsumer - The consumer function to apply to each record in the buffer.
      reverse - Indicates whether to iterate over the records in reverse order.
      Returns:
      The number of bytes read from the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      Checks if the buffer is dirty (contains data).

    • add

      public int add(int key, byte[] value, int valueOffset)
      Adds a key-value pair to the buffer at the current position.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to be added
      value - The byte array containing the value
      valueOffset - The offset in the value byte array
      Returns:
      The address in the buffer where the key-value pair is added
      Throws:
      BufferException - If the buffer is in read-only mode

    • update

      boolean update(int key, byte[] newValue, int valueOffset, int addressInBuffer)
      Attempts to update a key in the in-memory buffer after verifying the key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to be updated
      newValue - The byte array containing the new value
      valueOffset - The offset in the value byte array
      addressInBuffer - The address in the buffer at which the key-value pair exists
      Returns:
      true if the update succeeds after key verification, false otherwise

    • iterator

      Enumeration<ByteBuffer> iterator(boolean reverse)
      Returns an enumeration of byte buffers representing the key-value pairs in the buffer.
      Parameters:
      reverse - true if the enumeration should be in reverse order, false otherwise
      Returns:
      An enumeration of byte buffers
